info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 8:37PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MECKLENBURG AND CENTRAL UNION COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 837 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northwest of Monroe, or near Wesley Chapel, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monroe, South Charlotte, Matthews, Mint Hill, Indian Trail, Weddington, Stallings, Wesley Chapel, Lake Park, and Mineral Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
